alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 05 at 3:21PM AKST until January 06 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 6 PM AKST SATURDAY ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST AND NUNIVAK ISLAND... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. East winds gusting 40 to 60 mph. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta coast and Nunivak Island. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 6 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Widespread blowing snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will strengthen overnight tonight. As soon as snow arrives Saturday morning, conditions will rapidly deteriorate. The worst conditions will be between 9am and 3pm. Inland areas, including Bethel, may see a brief period of snow and blowing snow midday, reducing visibility to as low as one half mile. Temperatures will rise above freezing by evening while snow will taper off, leading to significant improvement in visibility.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
